messages.subject: Re: Casey :o) and other kidlets
messages.msgSnippet: ... by 18, ... at least a ... You sound like my mom. I have quite a few extra brothers than just my original 5. I think all but one of them had friends live
messages.messageBody:
--- In Unschooling-dotcom@y..., "Lynda" <lurine@s...> wrote:
> Let's see, eldest is 32, followed by 30, followed by 22, followed
by 18,
> followed by 14, followed by 9. Interspersed in amongst those are
at least a
> gazillion "adopted" kidlets who range(d) in age from 44 to 17.
>
> Lynda

You sound like my mom.
I have quite a few extra brothers than just my original 5.
I think all but one of them had friends live with us on and off
throughout highschool and college. Most of them ended up working for
my dad for atleast a little while in their lives.
Joanna

messages.subject: Re: [Unschooling-dotcom] Casey :o) and other kidlets
messages.msgSnippet: Let s see, eldest is 32, followed by 30, followed by 22, followed by 18, followed by 14, followed by 9.  Interspersed in amongst those are at least a gazillion
messages.messageBody:
Let's see, eldest is 32, followed by 30, followed by 22, followed by 18,
followed by 14, followed by 9. Interspersed in amongst those are at least a
gazillion "adopted" kidlets who range(d) in age from 44 to 17.

Lynda
----- Original Message -----
From: "zenmomma *" <zenmomma@...>
To: <Unschooling-dotcom@yahoogroups.com>
Sent: Sunday, March 24, 2002 6:19 PM
Subject: [Unschooling-dotcom] Casey :o) and other kidlets


>
>
> >>How old is Casey?>>
>
> >>Casey is 8.<<
>
> Oops. I meant to ask, Lynda. How many kids do you have and how old are
they?
> :o) I also have Conor, who is quickly approaching 13.
>
> Life is good.
> ~Mary

messages.subject: Casey :o) and other kidlets
messages.msgSnippet: ... Oops. I meant to ask, Lynda. How many kids do you have and how old are they? ... Life is good. ~Mary
messages.messageBody:
>>How old is Casey?>>

>>Casey is 8.<<

Oops. I meant to ask, Lynda. How many kids do you have and how old are they?
:o) I also have Conor, who is quickly approaching 13.

Life is good.
~Mary
